title: Rote (2004) New Testament (Print) SABDA
description:
The Timor languages are a group of Austronesian languages (belonging to the Centralâ€“Eastern subgroup) spoken on the islands of Timor, neighboring Wetar, and (depending on the classification) Southwest Maluku to the east.

Within the group, the languages with the most speakers are Uab Meto of West Timor, Indonesia, and Tetum of East Timor, each with about half a million speakers, though in addition, Tetum is an official language and a lingua franca among non-Tetum East Timorese.

language.name: Dela-Oenale
language.location: Indonesia, Nusa Tenggara and Southwestern Maluku
language.area: Rote Island west coast, Dela and Oe Nale domains.
